## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
library(raster)
library(spData)
library(dplyr)
library(spDataLarge)
library(sf)
library(ggplot2)
library(lwgeom)
punkt <- st_point(c(17, 52)) %>% st_sfc(crs = st_crs(world)) %>% st_sf()
ggplot()+  geom_sf(data = world)+  geom_sf(data = punkt, size = 4, col = 'dark green')+ theme_light()


```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
polygon_list = list(rbind(c(14,55), c(14,48), c(24, 48), c(24, 55),c(14,55)))
poligon <- st_polygon(polygon_list)%>%
  st_sfc(crs = 4326) %>%
  st_sf()

linestring_matrix = rbind(c(14, 53), c(16, 53),c(18,53),c(20,53),c(24,53))
line <- st_linestring(linestring_matrix) %>%
  st_sfc(crs = 4326) %>%
  st_sf()

pol<-filter(world,name_long=="Poland")
ggplot()+geom_sf(data = poligon,col="green")+geom_sf(data=pol)+geom_sf(data=line,col="red") 
```
 Powierzchnia Polski wynosi:
```{r}
st_area(pol) 
```
 
 
  
  Długość granic Polski to:
```{r}
st_cast(pol,"MULTILINESTRING")->granicaPol
st_length(granicaPol)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
